title: Auto-indent on closing brace
body:
VSCode Version: Code 1.30.2
OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.17763
Extensions: Extensions are enabled
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28403336/52084629-5500a980-2557-11e9-9175-8a91ef3efaf0.png)

on typing the closing brace. Meaning VSCode should take the current tab indentation size in account and auto-indent the code-block when typing the closing brace.

title: Git status bar fails to show branch of current file, on startup

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body: Issue Type: Bug When you open vscode-insder and you have two folders in the workspace on different branches it is automatically positioned on the first folder git branch also if the active file tab is of another folder. You need to deselect and select the file tab again to see the correct branch/git. This seems to happen only at vscode startup. VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.31.0-insider (7f136b44cff0cd3486ac88b43598b8c72b025d16, 2019-01-31T06:15:21.895Z) OS version: Linux x64 4.18.0-13-generic

title: Investigate SIGUSR1 usage
body: It seems `SIGUSR1` can be used with electron 3.x (see https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/11287). We should see if that's true and iff so adopt it where needed.

title: Node debugging: Breakpoints are verified
body:
My main folder is named "xyz.c++11.x32.root" (Linux). When I launch the node-debugger and try to set breakpoints, the breakpoints are listed as "Unverified breakpoint". 

When I rename the main folder to "xyz.root", then I can set breakpoints and the debugger stops at these breakpoints as expected.

title: Git API: getGlobalConfig, getConfig should return an empty string when key is not defined

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Testing #67276

Currently `Repository.getGlobalConfig()` and `Repository.getConfigu()` throw a non-obvious exception when a key is not defined:

```
C {error: undefined, message: "Failed to execute git", stdout: "", stderr: "", exitCode: 1, …}
error: undefined
exitCode: 1
gitCommand: "config"
gitErrorCode: undefined
message: "Failed to execute git"
stderr: ""
stdout: ""
__proto__: Object {constructor: , toString: }
```

As discussed with @joaomoreno these calls should better return an empty string.

title: Revealing in the editor should be aware of how much space the command palette is using
body:
Was trying to navigate symbols but I couldn't see the active symbol:

title: Can't run as different user unless installing system version

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.30.2
- OS Version: Windows 10, 1803 and Windows 10 1809

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Shift+Right Click on VSCode 
2. Click "Run As Different User" (The UAC Prompt will not show as it's supposed to.)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

I ran this on my normal laptop, running Windows 10 1809. Uninstalled VSCode and deleted all related files about 5 times thinking it was me. Finally ran it on my admin jump box which is running Windows 10 1803 and never had VSCode installed on it. I downloaded the newest version from the website and it still doesn't work. I can run all other programs as a different user just fine, that's why I think it's a VSCode bug.

EDIT: Also just tested and can't even click "Run As Administrator"

EDIT 2: Also tested forcing the runas through powershell window and it doesn't launch as the desired user. Command was:  `runas /netonly /user:<desired_Username_Here> "C:\Users\<current_user_name_here>\AppData\Local\Programs\Microsoft VS Code\Code.exe"`

title: Settings editor search links don't work if option currently filtered out
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.31 Insiders
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Filter down Settings editor with "double".
2. Window: Double Click Icon To Close has a link to Window: Title Bar Style
3. Click the link.

Settings editor goes back to starting view (Commonly Used) and doesn't find Window: Title Bar Style.

If no filtering is applied, clicking the link goes to Title Bar Style and correctly displays the gear icon. 

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

title: Icon Theme Setting UI does not update when using `Preferences: Icon Theme` command
body:
Testing #67283

When selecting from the dropdown in setting UI, the icon theme setting works fine:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4033249/51932666-6eb5bb80-23b4-11e9-9323-bd7ce04ac2d0.png)

However:

- Run `Preferences: Icon Theme` to select another icon theme
- Setting UI is not updated. You need to focus on the Setting UI to see the value updated. (Although the selected icon theme is already applied).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4033249/51932852-dc61e780-23b4-11e9-8322-14c9d423189e.png)

When I press enter, I expect both the File Explorer to update icons and the Setting UI update its value. But only the former happen.

title: Explorer filter box style issues

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
#66485

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2193314/51930902-72dfda00-23b0-11e9-8226-437c61260771.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2193314/51930970-9a36a700-23b0-11e9-84eb-5b15c16706f1.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2193314/51931631-30b79800-23b2-11e9-8b71-e6a1ea7c8cdc.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2193314/51931642-37dea600-23b2-11e9-9f86-954876dcb9f2.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2193314/51931734-6d838f00-23b2-11e9-85b6-1dcbd96a572b.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2193314/51931748-74aa9d00-23b2-11e9-84ec-67bdc70d2291.png)

Some observations:

- Both the list highlight and the filter box in the top-right are based on `editor.findMatchHighlightBackground`, but the filter box is far darker
- The filter box has a 45 degree drop shadow, I don't think we do this anywhere
- The filter box has rounded edges
- The icons are very blurry and not vertically aligned
- The filter options were very difficult to discover, I would not have come across them if I wasn't testing the feature

This is a similar UI component we have which maybe we should copy some style from?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2193314/51931185-10d3a480-23b1-11e9-9163-1cc94adf1d7c.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2193314/51931208-19c47600-23b1-11e9-917b-d996a7684441.png)

title: Allow multiple preLaunchTasks to be defined
body:
I would like to be able to have the launch.json preLaunchTask be an array of tasks rather than just one. While it is possible to create a compound task, this requires that the compound task also have a label which pollutes the tasks shown when choosing to run a task. Instead, I would like just have the launch config just be able to launch more than one.

In my scenario, I have tasks defined with labels "Watch", and "Dev Server". On debug launch, I want to be able to both ensure the Watch and "Dev Server" tasks have started (if not already running).

title: Settings search doesn't find a match
body: - VSCode Version: 1.30.2, 1.31.0 - OS Version: macOS High Sierra I was looking for a setting that I was sure must be there. The key words were "markdown tab size" and in retrospect, I was looking for this: ``` // Whether to use different indentation sizes on different context // - adaptive: Use 2 spaces for unordered list and 3 for the ordered // - inherit: Use the configured tab size of the current document (see vscode status bar) "markdown.extension.list.indentationSize": "adaptive" ``` All three search terms appear in this snippet. However, VSCode doesn't find it: Is it because the term "tab size" is only in a value description? In any case, from a human point of view, the setting should almost certainly come up with the search terms I'm using, right?

body:
I find that the alignment of breadcrumbs is weird. I am on Linux with zoom level 1 (though I also see it without zooming). To emphasize the box around breadcrumbs I added a green background:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/51900275-32368f80-23b5-11e9-9dd8-d01cf0a2d8ad.png)

Somehow the alignment of text, twistie and icon is not really vertically centered.

title: [folding] Show tooltip on hovering collapse markers

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
It would be nice to be able to hover the `⊞` and `⊟` symbols in the left gutter of the editor and see a tooltip saying what will happen if they're clicked\*, and showing which keyboard shortcut (if any) is assigned to the action, thus making the UI behavior more discoverable.

<sub>\* This may sound superfluous, but IMO it would help with promoting consistent nomenclature throughout the interface, e.g. "collapse"/"expand" vs. "fold"/"unfold" vs. "hide"/"show", etc.</sub>

title: JSON semantic selection should expand to line before selecting ','
body: Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/67277 See screen shot: Expanding the selection should not first expand `"search.exclude"` to cover the whole line before selecting the trailing `,`
